stimulusHtml: The architects who rebuilt Chartres Cathedral after a fire in 1194 C.E. employed an innovative ground plan and flying buttresses that became exemplary of High Gothic churches by enabling

features.html: The question refers to the images shown.

choicesHtml: the construction of a circular dome over the rectangular base of the transept
the construction of an ambulatory that allowed for more efficient flow of visitors
an increase in the height of the central nave while also allowing for enlarged clerestory windows
an increase in the height of the side aisles to the level of the nave, thereby creating a wide-open interior
